text: Gianluigi Donnarumma (born 25 February 1999 in Naples) is a professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) and the Italy national team. He also played for AC Milan from 2015 until 2020. On 1 September 2016, he became the youngest goalkeeper to ever play for the senior Italy national team. He played in the UEFA Euro 2020 Final, and helped Italy win the tournament after a penalty shootout. He was named the Player of the Tournament by UEFA. Donnarumma played for PSG in the 2025 UEFA Champions League final against Internazionale Milan, which PSG won 5â€“0. He saved two shots in the final. Earlier, in the Last Sixteen round, he had an outstanding match against Liverpool at Anfield, and ensured PSG's victory in the penalty shoot-out. == References == == Other websites == * Gianluigi Donnarumma at Soccerway * Gianluigi Donnarumma at FICG.it Category:Living people Category:1999 births Category:Italian association football goalkeepers Category:Footballers from Naples Category:A.C. title: Gianluigi Donnarumma
